enum  APS_KeyPairFlags_t {
  APS_FLAG_NONE = 0x00,
  APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_USED = 0x01,
  APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_AUTHORIZED = 0x02,
  APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_GLOBAL = 0x04,
  APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_PRIMARY_GLOBAL = 0x08,
  APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_TC = 0x10,
  APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_UPDATED = 0x20
}

Detailed Description

Access interface to cryptographic keys.

Author:
Microchip Corporation: http://www.microchip.com
Support email: support@microchip.com

Copyright (c) 2018, Microchip Corporation. All rights reserved. Licensed under Mirochip's Limited License Agreement.

Definition in file apsCryptoKeys.h.

Define Documentation

#define APS_DEFAULT_LINK_KEY
Value:
{0x5a, 0x69, 0x67, 0x42, 0x65, 0x65, 0x41, 0x6c,\
   0x6c, 0x69, 0x61, 0x6e, 0x63, 0x65, 0x30, 0x39}

Value of the default link key. See CCB 1039.

Definition at line 31 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

#define APS_KEY_HANDLE_IS_VALID (   handle)    ((APS_KeyPairIndex_t)0 <= (handle).idx)

Macro returns true if crypto key handle is valid.

Definition at line 35 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

#define APS_KEYS_FOUND (   handle)    APS_KEY_HANDLE_IS_VALID(handle)

Macro returns true if key-pair handle is successfully found.

Definition at line 37 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

#define APS_SECURED_WITH_ANY_LINK_KEY_STATUS (   securityStatus)
Value:
((APS_SECURED_LINK_KEY_STATUS == securityStatus) || \
   (APS_SECURED_TRUST_CENTER_LINK_KEY_STATUS == securityStatus) || \
   (APS_SECURED_HASH_OF_TRUST_CENTER_LINK_KEY_STATUS == securityStatus))

Macro returns true if security status is related to any security with link key.

Definition at line 40 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

#define APS_KEY_PAIR_INITIAL   -1

List of invalid and service key handle values. Initial and finish value of key-pair iterator.

Definition at line 47 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

Referenced by APS_KeyHandleUninitialized().

#define APS_KEY_PAIR_ALLOC_FAIL   -3

Memory for key-pair descriptor is out.

Definition at line 50 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

#define APS_KEY_PAIR_NOT_FOUND   -4

Key-pair is not found by device address.

Definition at line 52 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

#define APS_KEY_PAIR_INVALID_PARAMETER   -5

Parameter is out of range.

Definition at line 54 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

#define APS_KEY_PAIR_NO_INIT   -6

APS Key-Pair Set is not initialized.

Definition at line 56 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

#define APS_RESET_MASTER_KEY   0x01

Values of reset flag. These request reset master, link keys or counters. Zero or more flags can be bitwise-or'd in argument of APS_ResetKeys. Set default master key (zero key).

Definition at line 60 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

#define APS_RESET_LINK_KEY   0x02

Set default link key (zero key).

Definition at line 61 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

#define APS_RESET_COUNTERS   0x04

Set 0 to incoming and outgoing counters.

Definition at line 62 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct _APS_KeyHandle_t APS_KeyHandle_t

Type of cryptographic key handle.

typedef uint8_t APS_KeyResetFlags_t

Bit map of reset flags.

Definition at line 107 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum APS_KeyPairFlags_t
Enumerator:
APS_FLAG_NONE 

A flag indicating that there is no flags for key pair.

APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_USED 

A flag indicating that key-pair is used.

APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_AUTHORIZED 

A flag indicating that key-pair is authorized.

APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_GLOBAL 

A flag indicating uniquess/globalness of link key.

APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_PRIMARY_GLOBAL 

A flag indicating that global key is primary one, used in PAN which device is participating.

APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_TC 

A flag indicating if this is the link key for communication with TC.

APS_FLAG_KEY_PAIR_UPDATED 

A flag indicating that the link key is updated

Definition at line 87 of file apsCryptoKeys.h.

void APS_SetAuthorizedStatus ( const ExtAddr_t *const  deviceAddress,
const bool  status 
)

(Un)authorize cryptographic key-pair of given device.

Parameters:
[in]deviceAddress[LE] - pointer to extended IEEE device address.
[in]status- 'true' for authorized keys otherwise 'false'.
Returns:
None.
bool APS_AreKeysAuthorized ( const ExtAddr_t *const  deviceAddress)

Check authorization of crypthographic key-pair.

Parameters:
[in]deviceAddress[LE] - pointer to extended IEEE device address.
Returns:
'true' if key-pair is authorized otherwise 'false'.
APS_KeyHandle_t APS_ResetKeys ( const ExtAddr_t *const  deviceAddress,
const APS_KeyResetFlags_t  flags 
)

Reset device's keys and counters to default values.

Parameters:
[in]deviceAddress[LE] - pointer to extended IEEE device address.
[in]flags- bit map of APS Key-Pair reset flags. Current implementation supported only APS_RESET_LINK_KEY and APS_RESET_COUNTERS.
Returns:
APS Key Handle of reseting key-pair or invalid key handle if key-pair is not found.

uint8_t* APS_GetPreinstalledLinkKey ( const APS_KeyHandle_t  handle)

Get preinstalled link key.

Parameters:
[in]handle- valid key handle.
Returns:
Pointer to preinstalled link key or NULL if handle is invalid.
APS_KeyHandle_t APS_SetPreinstalledLinkKey ( const ExtAddr_t *const  deviceAddress,
const uint8_t *const  preinstalledLinkKey 
)

Set new preinstalled link key for given device.

This function copies value of preinstalled link key to APS Key-Pair Set.

Parameters:
[in]deviceAddress- pointer to extended IEEE device address.
[in]preinstalledLinkKey- pointer to new cryptographic preinstalled link key.
Returns:
Valid key handle if operation is successfully completed otherwise invalid key handle (Use APS_KEY_HANDLE_IS_VALID to check it out).
void APS_RestorePreinstalledLinkKey ( const ExtAddr_t *const  deviceAddress)

Restores link key from preinstalled one. Uses to accept TC reestablishing keys with previously joined device.

Parameters:
[in]deviceAddress- pointer to extended IEEE device address.
Returns:
None.
void APS_StorePreinstalledLinkKey ( const ExtAddr_t *const  deviceAddress)

Stores link key to preinstalled one.

Get current value of outgoing security frames counter.

Parameters:
[in]keyHandle- valid key handle.
Returns:
Current value of outgoing frame counter.
APS_Status_t APS_SetOutSecFrameCounter ( ExtAddr_t  deviceAddress,
ApsOutFrameCounter_t  counter 
)

Set the new value of outgoing security frame counter for the device.

Parameters:
[in]deviceAddress- IEEE extended address
[in]counter- new value of the outgoing security counter for given device.
Returns:
APS_SUCCESS_STATUS - counter was updated successfuly APS_INVALID_PARAMETER_STATUS - if deviceAddress is not correct and it's not possible to find any record related to the passed address.
void APS_MarkGlobalKeyAsPrimary ( APS_KeyHandle_t  handle)

Mark specified gloabal key as 'primary'. It will used as default key for all transactions with unknown (unregistered in KeyPairSet) devices inside a PAN.

Parameters:
[in]handle- valid global key handle.
Returns:
None.

Returns:

bool APS_IsGlobalLinkKey ( const APS_KeyHandle_t  handle)

Is the handle assocciated with a global or unique link key?

Parameters:
[in]handle- valid key handle.
Returns:
true if handle is assocciated with a global link key otherwise false.
bool APS_IsTclkUpdated ( const APS_KeyHandle_t  handle)

Is the handle assocciated with a updated TCLK or not?

Parameters:
[in]handle- valid key handle.
Returns:
true if handle is assocciated with a global link key otherwise false.
APS_KeyHandle_t APS_IsIndividualKeyAvailable ( const ExtAddr_t *const  deviceAddress)

Find initial (master key for High Security and preinstalled link key) or link key of device.

Parameters:
[in]deviceAddress- pointer to extended IEEE device address.
Returns:
Valid key handle if any key is found otherwise invalid key handle (Use APS_KEYS_FOUND to check it out).
